definition: to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
to construct/to form/to make up/to compose/literary composition/paper mulberry (Broussonetia papyrifera)
variant of 構|构[gou4]/(Tw) (coll.) variant of 夠|够[gou4]/to reach by stretching

sentences.english: These conclusions provide the basis for cladding design of high-rise buildings.
sentences.chinese: 这些结论为高层建筑围护结构的设计提供了参考。

sentences.english: To creat a comfortable indoor environment is one of the basic goals of construction surrounding protection structure.
sentences.chinese: 创造舒适的室内环境是建筑围护结构的基本目标之一。

sentences.english: Research on the wind-resistant design methods of long-span roofs.
sentences.chinese: 大跨度屋盖围护结构的设计风荷载研究。

sentences.english: The variation of the underground water levels in the outside of the foundation pit could reflect the watertight effect of the retaining structures.
sentences.chinese: 坑外地下水位的变化可反映围护结构的止水效果。

sentences.english: Therefore, energy efficiency in buildings should firstly start from building envelope.
sentences.chinese: 因此，建筑节能先从建筑围护结构节能开始。

sentences.english: It is the thermal resistance that increases palisade structure and thermal stability.
sentences.chinese: 一是增大围护结构的热阻和热稳定性。

sentences.english: Ancient Road east to the ancient Yang Road construction projects completed over half of the wall structure.
sentences.chinese: 虹古路至古羊路工程完成地下围护结构施工一半以上。

sentences.english: The construction techniques include a high performance building envelop and triple glazed windows.
sentences.chinese: 施工技术包括高性能围护结构和三层玻璃窗。

definition: roof/roof plate/rock layer forming roof of a cave or mine/abacus
a building/the frame of a building/roof beam/truss
civil engineering/same as 土木工程[tu3 mu4 gong1 cheng2]
to plaster/to render (a wall)/(fig.) to bring shame on/also pr. [mo4 hui1]
